snippet: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority told leaders of his political party on Tuesday that the government would resign within 24 hours.
abstract: Palestinian Authority Pres Mahmoud Abbas reportedly tells party leaders that ineffective government he formed in 2014 after signing reconciliation pact with Hamas will resign within 24 hours; so-called consensus government is now headed by Prime Min Rami Hamdallah.

byline.contributor: Diaa Hadid contributed reporting from Gaza City, and Rami Nazzal from Ramallah, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority told leaders of his political party on Tuesday that the government would resign within 24 hours.

headline.main: Palestinian Government Is Expected to Resign
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Government Is Expected to Resign
